title: Godawari Municipality Road Construction Corruption Case
description:
The Commission for Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) filed five separate corruption cases against officials and contractors of Godawari Municipality, Kailali, over irregularities in the construction of 13 municipal roads. The accused allegedly caused significant financial loss to the state by making and approving payments for substandard and incomplete work.

The investigation revealed that former Chief Administrative Officers Khemraj Bista and Devraj Joshi colluded with engineers, sub-engineers, and contractors. They are accused of knowingly approving payments based on fraudulent measurement books and technical reports that misrepresented the quality and progress of the road construction projects.

The CIAA filed chargesheets at the Special Court in Kathmandu, implicating a total of 14 individuals. The key individuals and the total claimed damages (bigo) sought by the CIAA are as follows:

  • Khemraj Bista (Former Chief Administrative Officer): NPR 64,806,216
  • Devraj Joshi (Former Chief Administrative Officer): NPR 3,129,746
  • Purna Kunwar (Former Engineer): NPR 9,615,962
  • Gyanendra Budha (Former Sub-Engineer): NPR 3,219,514
  • Narendra Shahi (Former Sub-Engineer): NPR 3,677,000
  • Bhaktaraj Joshi (Former Sub-Engineer): NPR 2,758,432
  • Dhan Bahadur Bista (Lab Technician): NPR 8,441,923
  • Dambar Chand (Contractor): NPR 8,200,000
  • Santosh Joshi (Contractor): NPR 3,798,000
  • Kami Sherpa (Contractor): NPR 2,928,000
  • Harisingh Bista (Contractor): NPR 1,517,000

The charges include corruption, abuse of authority, and collusion to embezzle government funds. The case highlights a systemic issue of officials overstepping their jurisdiction to interfere in technical evaluations for personal gain.
unverified_info: An initial document reviewed for this case listed one of the accused as 'Khemraj Joshi'. However, all subsequent official press releases from the CIAA and reputable media reports consistently name the second accused Chief Administrative Officer as Devraj Joshi. It is highly probable that 'Khemraj Joshi' was a typographical error in the initial source.

timeline.title: CIAA Files First Set of Charges
timeline.description: The CIAA filed a corruption case at the Special Court against officials of Godawari Municipality, including Khemraj Bista and Devraj Joshi, concerning substandard road construction.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Second Case
timeline.description: The CIAA filed another corruption case against municipal officials related to the ongoing investigation into road projects.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Additional Charges, Totaling Five Cases
timeline.description: The CIAA filed additional charge sheets at the Special Court, Kathmandu, against Khemraj Bista, Devraj Joshi, and seven others, bringing the total number of related corruption cases to five.
